episodeTitle: I Will Get Much, Much Stronger! Zoro's Pledge to his Captain!
episodeTitleJapanese: まだまだ強くなる！ゾロ船長への誓い
episodeTitleRomanized: Madamada Tsuyoku Naru! Zoro Senchō e no Chikai
description: The Straw Hat Pirates continue their individual journeys across the world. Brook performs as a freak show attraction while reflecting on Luffy's kindness. Robin decides to join the Revolutionary Army to meet Dragon. Usopp resolves to train with Heracles. Most significantly, Zoro swallows his pride and asks his rival Mihawk to train him, explaining Luffy's hidden 3D2Y message about reuniting in two years instead of three days.

events.title: Brook's Performance as Freak Show Attraction
events.description: At Kenzan Island, Brook is being displayed in a cage as part of a freak show attraction. Despite his humiliating circumstances, he holds a newspaper and reflects on how grateful he is to Luffy for everything he has done for him.
events.significance: Shows Brook's dedication to his captain and his willingness to endure hardship while waiting for Luffy's signal. Demonstrates the emotional bond between crew members.

quotes.text: Thank you, Luffy... for everything you've done for me.
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook reflecting on Luffy's kindness while imprisoned

events.title: Brook Performs 'Bone to Be Wild'
events.description: Brook takes out his guitar and performs his new single 'Bone to Be Wild' for the crowd, showing his determination to move forward and continue to support Luffy as a musician.
events.significance: Marks Brook's decision to use his time during the separation productively, setting up his future career as a famous musician that will aid the crew.

events.title: Robin Decides to Join Revolutionary Army
events.description: At a bridge in East Blue, Robin makes the decision to go with the Revolutionary Army to Baltigo to meet Monkey D. Dragon. The revolutionaries question why she suddenly changed her mind, prompting her to have flashbacks of Ohara's destruction and Luffy saving her at Enies Lobby.
events.significance: Critical character development for Robin as she chooses to learn from the Revolutionary Army, setting up her two-year training period and deepening her connection to the world's underground resistance movement.

quotes.text: I've decided to go to Baltigo.
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin announcing her decision to the Revolutionary Army

events.title: Robin's Flashback to Ohara and Enies Lobby
events.description: Robin reflects on her traumatic past, remembering the destruction of Ohara and Saul's final words to her. The flashback then shifts to Luffy's desperate efforts to save her during the Enies Lobby arc, reinforcing why she's willing to become stronger for him.
events.significance: Provides emotional context for Robin's decision to train with the Revolutionary Army. Shows how Luffy's actions at Enies Lobby gave her the will to live and fight for her future.

quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin's declaration at Enies Lobby, shown in flashback

events.title: Usopp Resolves to Train
events.description: At the Boin Archipelago, Usopp makes the decision to train seriously for Luffy's sake. Heracles is touched by Usopp's determination and begins teaching him about Pop Greens and survival techniques.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Usopp's two-year training period where he will master the use of Pop Greens, significantly enhancing his combat abilities for the New World.

quotes.text: I'm going to become the King of Snipers!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp declaring his determination to train

events.title: Zoro Asks Mihawk to Train Him
events.description: At Kuraigana Island, Zoro goes down on his knees and begs Dracule Mihawk to train him to become a stronger swordsman. Mihawk is initially disgusted by this display, questioning why Zoro would bow to an enemy and ask for training.
events.significance: This is a monumental moment for Zoro's character - swallowing his immense pride to ask his rival for help. It demonstrates Zoro's complete dedication to Luffy and his dream, willing to set aside his own ego for the sake of his captain and crew.

quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro kneeling before Mihawk, asking for training

events.title: Zoro Reveals He Defeated All the Humandrills
events.description: When Mihawk expresses disgust at Zoro's request, Zoro reveals that he has already defeated all of the Humandrills outside the castle. Mihawk is genuinely surprised by this feat, as the Humandrills are formidable opponents who can mimic sword techniques.
events.significance: Proves Zoro's worthiness to be trained by Mihawk and shows his significant growth even before the training begins. The defeat of the Humandrills demonstrates Zoro's determination and skill.

quotes.text: I defeated all of them. Now the only one left to beat is you.
quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro informing Mihawk of his accomplishment

events.title: Mihawk Understands Zoro's Motivation
events.description: Mihawk questions why Zoro would bow to an enemy and ask for training. When Zoro answers that he wants to overcome Mihawk to become stronger, Mihawk realizes that Zoro wants to get stronger for Luffy, not for his own ambitions. This understanding leads Mihawk to agree to train him.
events.significance: Reveals the depth of Zoro's loyalty to Luffy and shows a rare moment of respect from Mihawk. This marks a shift in their relationship from pure rivalry to mentor-student, though the goal of surpassing Mihawk remains.

quotes.text: I want to overcome you. I need to become stronger... for him.
quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro explaining his motivation to Mihawk

events.title: Mihawk Agrees to Train Zoro
events.description: After understanding Zoro's true motivation, Mihawk agrees to train him, but only after Perona heals his injuries. Mihawk is amused by the irony of training someone who plans to take his head in the future.
events.significance: Establishes the beginning of Zoro's two-year training period under the World's Greatest Swordsman. This training will be crucial for Zoro's development and preparation for the New World.

quotes.text: Very well. Once your wounds are healed, I will train you.
quotes.speaker: Dracule Mihawk

events.title: Zoro Explains the 3D2Y Message
events.description: Zoro explains Luffy's hidden message to Perona. The '3D2Y' tattoo means the Straw Hats will reunite in two years instead of the original plan of three days. The 3D is crossed out, indicating the change in plans.
events.significance: This is the key revelation that explains Luffy's cryptic actions and establishes the two-year timeskip. It shows Luffy's strategic thinking and his trust that his crew will understand the message.

quotes.text: The original plan was to meet up in three days. But now it's two years. That's what the message means - 3D crossed out, 2Y.
quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro

events.title: All Straw Hats Commit to Two Years of Training
events.description: The episode shows various Straw Hat members across different locations, all understanding Luffy's message and committing to reunite at Sabaody Archipelago after two years of intensive training.
events.significance: Establishes the timeskip framework and shows the unity of the crew despite being scattered across the world. Each member's commitment to become stronger demonstrates their dedication to their captain and their shared dream.

quotes.text: In two years... we'll meet again at Sabaody!
quotes.speaker: Various Straw Hats
quotes.context: The crew's shared commitment to reunite

quotes.text: I want to overcome you. I need to become stronger... for him.
quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro

quotes.text: Very well. Once your wounds are healed, I will train you.
quotes.speaker: Dracule Mihawk

quotes.text: The original plan was to meet up in three days. But now it's two years.
quotes.speaker: Roronoa Zoro

themes.description: The episode powerfully demonstrates the crew's loyalty to Luffy, particularly through Zoro's willingness to set aside his pride and ask his rival for training. Each crew member makes personal sacrifices to become stronger for their captain.
themes.symbolism: Zoro kneeling before Mihawk symbolizes the ultimate sacrifice of pride for a greater purpose - protecting and supporting one's captain and crew.

themes.description: All the Straw Hats embrace difficult training and challenging circumstances to grow stronger. The episode emphasizes that true strength comes from pushing past one's limits and accepting help from others.
themes.symbolism: The two-year separation represents the necessary period of individual growth before the crew can reunite and face greater challenges together.

themes.description: Despite being scattered across the world, the Straw Hats remain connected through their shared understanding of Luffy's message and their commitment to reunite. Their bond transcends physical distance.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's 3D2Y message serves as a symbol of trust and connection, showing that true nakama can communicate and understand each other even when apart.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro reaches a new level of character development by setting aside his enormous pride to ask Mihawk for training. This shows his complete dedication to Luffy and the crew, prioritizing their collective strength over his personal ego.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on Brook's performance scene with additional dialogue and musical performance that wasn't detailed in the manga.
The anime adds more visual detail to Robin's flashbacks of Ohara and Enies Lobby compared to the manga's briefer treatment.

trivia.fact: Episode 515 is one of the final episodes before the two-year timeskip, marking the end of the first half of the One Piece anime series.
This episode features the opening theme 'Fight Together' by Namie Amuro for the last time, as it was only used for episodes 493-516.
The scene of Zoro kneeling before Mihawk is considered one of the most iconic character moments in One Piece, showcasing Zoro's complete loyalty to Luffy.
The 3D2Y message is adapted from manga chapter 597, which was titled '3D2Y' and marked a major turning point in the series.
